text: THIRD PARTY DISCLAIMER
label: HH1

text: This report and all subsidiary reports are prepared solely for the Federal Transit Administration
label: BODY

text: (FTA).  This report should not be relied upon by any party, except FTA or the project sponsor, in
label: BODY

text: accordance with the purposes as described below.
label: BODY

text: For projects funded through FTA Full Funding Grant Agreements (FFGAs) program, FTA and
label: BODY

text: its Project Management Oversight contractor (PMOC) use a risk-based assessment process to
label: BODY

text: review and validate a project sponsor’s budget and schedule.  This risk-based assessment process
label: BODY

text: is a tool for analyzing project development and management.  Moreover, the assessment process
label: BODY

text: is iterative in nature; any results of an FTA or PMOC risk-based assessment represent a
label: BODY

text: “snapshot in time” for a particular project under the conditions known at that same point in time.
label: BODY

text: The status of any assessment may be altered at any time by new information, changes in
label: BODY

text: circumstances, or further developments in the project, including any specific measures a sponsor
label: BODY

text: may take to mitigate the risks to project costs, budget, and schedule, or the strategy a sponsor
label: BODY

text: may develop for project execution.  Therefore, the information in the monthly reports will
label: BODY

text: change from month to month, based on relevant factors for the month and/or previous months.
label: BODY

text: REPORT FORMAT AND FOCUS
label: HH1

text: This report is submitted in compliance with the terms of the Federal Transit Administration
label: BODY

text: (FTA) Contract No. DTFT60-09-D-00007, Task Order No. 002.  Its purpose is to provide
label: BODY

text: information and data to assist the FTA as it continually monitors the grantee’s technical
label: BODY

text: capability and capacity to execute a project efficiently and effectively, and hence, whether the
label: BODY

text: grantee continues to be ready to receive federal funds for further project development.
label: BODY

text: This report covers the project management activities on the East Side Access (ESA) Mega-
label: BODY

text: Project managed by MTA Capital Construction (MTACC) with MTA as the grantee and
label: BODY

text: financed by the FTA FFGA.
label: BODY

text: MONITORING REPORT
label: HH1

text: 1.0 PROJECT STATUS
label: HH1

text: a. Design
label: HH1

text: As of July 31, 2013, MTACC reported that the Engineering/Design effort was 97.7% complete
label: BODY

text: in the ESA July ’13 Monthly Progress Report; however the Cost Report shows only 93.1%
label: BODY

text: complete on a cost invoiced basis.  The percent complete varies monthly depending on the award
label: BODY

text: of tasks to the GEC.
label: BODY

text: The 100% submittal for the Stage 3 catenary design (FHA03) was sent to Amtrak on May 3,
label: BODY

text: 2013 and discussed with them in early July.  Amtrak requested a walk-through on July 26, 2013
label: BODY

text: to address the bonding and grounding plan, which resulted in additional comments that the
label: BODY

text: Project Management Team (PMT) subsequently addressed.  The 100% submittal is now
label: BODY

text: finalized.
label: BODY

text: Amtrak is currently reviewing the FHA04 Stage 4 catenary 60% design submittal and ESA is
label: BODY

text: waiting for comments.  The PMT is proceeding with the 90% design and anticipates completing
label: BODY

text: it by the end of September 2013.
label: BODY

text: The confirmatory set of drawings for CM014B was circulated between the major stakeholders
label: BODY

text: (LIRR, MNR) in April 2013 for assurance that all of their comments have been adequately
label: BODY

text: FOIA Exemption 5 U.S.C. Section 552(b)(4)
label: BODY

text: August 2013 Monthly Report
label: HH1

text: MTACC-ESA
label: BODY

text: PMT’s calculations on procurement are done against the $8.245B budget, without the Rolling
label: BODY

text: Stock Reserve.
label: BODY

text: The second new contract package of the CM012R repackaging, CM006 (northern structures),
label: BODY

text: was advertised on August 15, 2013, with RFP documents made available to perspective
label: BODY

text: proposers on August 26, 2013.  The current RFP due date is October 17, 2013.  The third new
label: BODY

text: contract package, CM007 (Main Caverns) remains under development.  The advertise date for
label: BODY

text: this package remains TBD.
label: BODY

text: The continuing slippage of awarding CS179 (Systems Package 1) remains a major concern.  This
label: BODY

text: contract is on the critical path of the May 2012 approved baseline schedule.  MTACC committed
label: BODY

text: in April 2013 to have a recommendation for award ready to present to the MTA Board in July
label: BODY

text: 2013, and that date was not met.  The ESA PMT then re-forecast recommendation to award
label: BODY

text: ready to present at September 2013 MTA Board meeting, with award of the Contract following
label: BODY

text: in late September/early October 2013.  The PMOC was informed in August 2013 that MTACC
label: BODY

text: will not have a recommendation for award in time for the September 2013 Board meeting, as the
label: BODY

text: ESA team continues negotiations and has yet to select a contractor.  The planned award date and
label: BODY

text: NTP remains TBD.
label: BODY

text: The PMT has decided to split the Tunnel Systems package (CS284) into two packages: one for
label: BODY

text: track work and one for the traction power work.  Procurement dates for this package are now
label: BODY

text: TBD.  This split will have an impact on the Systems Package 1 (CS179) Contractor, who is
label: BODY

text: responsible for systems integration for these packages.
label: BODY

text: Notice to Proceed (NTP) for the Signal Equipment package (VS086), which is being negotiated
label: BODY

text: as an RFP, remains TBD (note: proposals for this RFP were received in January 2013).
label: BODY

text: The previous IPS update indicates that the CM014B package will be ready to advertise on
label: BODY

text: September 1, 2013.  The ESA PMT has stopped providing IPS updates, so there is no current
label: BODY

text: forecast on when this package will be advertised, however it clearly will not be September 1,
label: BODY

text: Bids were opened for CH057A on August 8, 2013.  There were eight bidders and the low bid
label: BODY

text: was $104,300,000, which was under the ESA’s budgeted amount.  Formal award is expected in
label: BODY

text: September 2013.  Remaining work in CH057 was forecast in the previous IPS to be advertised in
label: BODY

text: August 2013, with NTP forecast for January 2014.  The date is now TBD as the PMT considers
label: BODY

text: repackaging options based on the outcome of the Harold work schedule review/re-baselining that
label: BODY

text: it is conducting.
label: BODY

text: c. Construction
label: HH1

text: The PMT reported in its July 2013 Monthly Progress Report that the actual construction progress
label: BODY

text: was 52.9% vs. 55.1% planned.  Over the last several months, progress has only been proceeding
label: BODY

text: at about half the rate as projected.
label: BODY

text: Manhattan:  CM009/019 – Manhattan Tunnels Excavation/Structures Part 1:  The Estimate
label: HH1

text: at Completion (EAC) for the CM009 contract remained at $402,706,000 as of July 31, 2013.
label: BODY

text: Substantial Completion (SC) of the base contract was achieved on June 1, 2013, after which the
label: BODY

text: MTACC awarded Contract Modification #46 to the contractor for the application of shotcrete
label: BODY

text: and invert construction in 3 of the previously excavated caverns.  This work is advance
label: BODY

text: construction for the future CM006 contract.  The MTACC established new Milestone 9A, with a
label: BODY

text: August 2013 Monthly Report
label: HH1

text: MTACC-ESA
label: BODY

text: Substantial Completion date of September 30, 2013.  Actual progress for July 2013 was 1.3%
label: BODY

text: versus 1.8% planned.  Cumulative progress through July 31, 2013, adjusted for Milestone 9A,
label: BODY

text: was 96.2% actual versus 96.4% planned.
label: BODY

text: CM019 Status:  All construction for Substantial Completion (except punch list repairs) was
label: BODY

text: completed by June 1, 2013, but the PMT has not been able to declare SC yet because of an on-
label: BODY

text: going Code Compliance issue with pneumatically applied concrete (PAC) that CM019 used
label: BODY

text: throughout the caverns.  Currently, the issue is being reviewed by an independent engineer, but
label: BODY

text: there is no estimated date for a decision.  Until this determination is made, the PMT will not be
label: BODY

text: able to issue a Substantial Completion notice.
label: BODY

text: Construction Progress:  During August 2013, the CM009 contractor continued construction with
label: BODY

text: the installation of waterproofing and reinforcing bars, and the initial placement of invert concrete
label: BODY

text: in the GCT 3 and GCT 4 West Wye and Crossover caverns and the GCT 5 West Wye cavern.
label: BODY

text: CM013 – 50th Street Vent Facility:  MTACC reports that through July 31, 2013, the EAC
label: HH1

text: remains at $126.41 million.  Forecast Substantial Completion date has changed to December 31,
label: BODY

text: 2013 from the previous November 2013.  As of July 31, 2013, the actual percent complete was
label: BODY

text: 85.2% vs. 99.9% planned.
label: BODY

text: Construction Progress:  The stop-work-order issued by the Code Compliance Unit (CCU) over
label: BODY

text: the placement of PAC was “partially” lifted during August 2013.  This allowed the resumption of
label: BODY

text: Stair #1 construction in the shaft.  The erection, inspection and approval of a CCU required
label: BODY

text: mock-up of the pneumatic concrete wall remains.  Concrete slab placement within the building is
label: BODY

text: complete.  Concrete block wall erection is 90% complete throughout the building.  Preparations
label: BODY

text: began for the installation of the finish building and utility chase cladding.
label: BODY

text: CM013A – 55th Street Vent Facility: MTACC reports that through July 31, 2013 the EAC
label: HH1

text: remained at $58.85 million. Forecast Substantial Completion date is now March 11, 2015 from
label: BODY

text: the original and previous April 5, 2015. As of July 31, 2013, MTACC reports that the actual
label: BODY

text: percent complete is slightly ahead of schedule at 16.1% vs. 15.3% planned.
label: BODY

text: Construction Progress:  During August 2013, the contractor continued with mechanical
label: BODY

text: excavation in the northeast and northwest sections of the site and began excavation at the
label: BODY

text: southwest section under the street decking.  Installation of temporary sewer bypass and steam
label: BODY

text: main was completed.  Support of utilities under the decking continued, and the Project Office
label: BODY

text: continues to work with Con Ed on expediting their required abatement work so that steam main
label: BODY

text: work can proceed.
label: BODY

text: CM004 – 44th Street Building Demolition and Fan Plant Structure; 245 Park Avenue
label: HH1

text: Entrance: MTACC reports that through July 31, 2013 the EAC remained at $63.33 million.  The
label: HH1

text: Forecast Substantial Completion date is January 15, 2014 for the Vent Plant. Beneficial Use for
label: BODY

text: the 245 Park Entrance is forecast for January 15, 2014. The actual percent complete is 85.5%
label: BODY

text: versus 95.2% planned.
label: BODY

text: Construction Progress:  The above-grade steel erection is complete. The remaining below grade
label: BODY

text: steel fabrication is complete and erection of this steel is forthcoming.  This below grade steel is
label: BODY

text: necessary for the placement of the ground floor concrete slab and support for the Gantry Crane
label: BODY

text: that is being re-installed in the building to support upcoming contracts.  The second floor steel
label: BODY

text: has been fabricated.  This steel, some louvers, windows, limestone building finish and other
label: BODY

text: August 2013 Monthly Report
label: HH1

text: MTACC-ESA
label: BODY

text: materials will be stored for installation by the CM014B contractor after the Gantry Crane is
label: BODY

text: removed.  The contractor continued with application of intumescent paint and column/beam
label: BODY

text: concrete encasement. Completion of temporary stair erection continued.
label: BODY

text: CM014A– Concourse and Facilities Fit-Out:  MTACC reports that through July 31, 2013 the
label: HH1

text: EAC remains at $52.00 million.  Forecast Substantial Completion date remains February 15,
label: BODY

text: 2014. The actual percent complete reported is 44.5% versus 85.9% planned. This large gap
label: BODY

text: between percent complete versus planned can be largely attributed to the Supervisory Control
label: BODY

text: and Data Acquisition (SCADA) system redesign (based on LIRR requirements), which resulted
label: BODY

text: in a hold being placed on fabrication and delivery of all power system equipment until the
label: BODY

text: redesign was complete.
label: BODY

text: Construction Progress: During August 2013, the contractor completed floor slab placement.
label: BODY

text: Masons continued with block wall erection for various rooms. Placement of equipment pads
label: BODY

text: began and erection of sheet metal ductwork and overhead piping continued.  HVAC units were
label: BODY

text: delivered and stored at the site.  Testing of ABB Transformers was successfully completed at the
label: BODY

text: Texas plant under the observation of an MTACC representative.
label: BODY

text: Queens:  CQ031 – Queens Bored Tunnels and Structures:  The Estimate at Completion
label: HH1

text: remained at $780,384,000 as of July 31, 2013.  The MTACC forecast for Substantial Completion
label: BODY

text: of the amended CQ031 contract has been extended to April 9, 2014.  The amended contract
label: BODY

text: presently includes installation of secant piles and support of excavation (SOE) for the eastward
label: BODY

text: extension of Tunnel A and the construction of a concrete slab for track support under
label: BODY

text: Amtrak/LIRR Lines 2 and 4 for the future Westbound Bypass Tunnel.    Cumulative progress
label: BODY

text: through July 31, 2013 was 97.5% versus 100.0% planned.
label: BODY

text: Construction Progress:  During August 2013, the contractor successfully completed installation
label: BODY

text: of the concrete slabs under Lines 2 and 4 and continued to install SOE secant and soldier piles
label: BODY

text: for the extension of Tunnel A.  As of August 29, 2013, the contractor had installed 179 secant
label: BODY

text: piles (of a total of 246) and all 30 soldier piles.  Additionally, the contractor continued final
label: BODY

text: painting and punch list repairs at the Yard Lead Emergency Exit and B-13 Substation buildings.
label: BODY

text: CQ032 – Plaza Substation and Queens Structures:  The Estimate at Completion remained at
label: HH1

text: $192,680,000 as of July 31, 2013.  The MTACC forecast Substantial Completion date has been
label: BODY

text: extended by a month to August 1, 2015.  Actual construction progress for July 2013 was 3.5%
label: BODY

text: versus 3.9% planned.  Cumulative progress through July 31, 2013, was 33.3% actual versus
label: BODY

text: 61.7% planned.  ESA and the Contractor are presently developing a re-baselined Contract
label: BODY

text: schedule based upon additional work on the 63rd street eastbound tunnel rehabilitation that will
label: BODY

text: more accurately reflect the status of actual vs. planned work.
label: BODY

text: Construction Progress:  During August 2013, the contractor completed excavation in Area 1A,
label: BODY

text: continued to pour concrete invert slab sections in the Plaza Substation area, continued
label: BODY

text: waterproofing and shotcrete application in the Yard Lead Trench, continued to install CMU
label: BODY

text: walls on the exterior and interior of B-10 Substation, and continued miscellaneous construction
label: BODY

text: at the intermediate facility buildings at Roosevelt Ave., Vernon Blvd, and 12th and 29th streets.
label: BODY

text: CQ039 – Northern Boulevard Crossing:  As of July 31, 2013, the Estimate at Completion
label: HH1

text: remained at $101,605,000.  The MTACC forecast Substantial Completion date was extended by
label: BODY

text: 3 weeks to September 6, 2013.  Actual construction progress for July 2013 was 0.6% versus
label: BODY

text: August 2013 Monthly Report
label: HH1

text: MTACC-ESA
label: BODY

text: 0.0% planned (project was expected to be complete by now).  Cumulative construction progress
label: BODY

text: through July 31, 2013, was 96.5% versus 100.0%.
label: BODY

text: Construction Progress:  The contractor completed removal of the four remaining support piles
label: BODY

text: that were located inside the Northern Blvd. tunnel in late July 2013, and made punch list repairs
label: BODY

text: during August.  All major construction at the site has been completed, but Substantial
label: BODY

text: Completion will not be declared until the compensation grouting behind the tunnel liner is
label: BODY

text: complete.  This process is presently being delayed because the ground around the tunnel liner has
label: BODY

text: not fully thawed from the ground freeze (thaw was begun in February/March 2013 timeframe).
label: BODY

text: There is no forecast date for when the full thaw will occur.
label: BODY

text: Harold Interlocking:  CH053 Contract – Harold Structures Part 1 and G.0.2 Substation:
label: HH1

text: Through July 31, 2013, the Estimate at Completion remains at $281,038,000.  The MTACC
label: BODY

text: forecast Substantial Completion date was extended by one week to June 11, 2014.  Actual
label: BODY

text: construction progress for July 2013 was 1.2% versus 0.0% planned (project was supposed to
label: BODY

text: have been completed).  Cumulative construction progress through July 31, 2013, was 81.0%
label: BODY

text: actual versus 100.0% planned.  Although significantly behind schedule, this contract is not
label: BODY

text: currently on the overall ESA project critical path.
label: BODY

text: Construction Progress:  The CH053 contractor completed removal of existing signal towers 29
label: BODY

text: through 34 during August 2013.  This allowed the contractor to resume installation in support of
label: BODY

text: excavation (SOE) and excavation for the westward extension of the Tunnel A Approach
label: BODY

text: structure (the towers prevented this previously).  The contractor also continued construction of
label: BODY

text: the bridge abutments at 43rd and 48th streets for the new realigned LIRR ML4 track and
label: BODY

text: continued construction of the 43-S2 retaining wall between 43rd and 48th streets.  Due to limited
label: BODY

text: Force Account support because of the continuous westbound bypass concrete slab construction
label: BODY

text: during the first half of August 2013, the contractor’s progress on the 12kV ductbank and cable
label: BODY

text: installation was greatly restricted, although a small amount of miscellaneous progress was made.
label: BODY

label: BODY

text: FHA02 – Harold Stage 2 Amtrak:  The Estimate at Completion remained at $38,495,000
label: HH1

text: during July 2013.  The MTACC’s forecast for Substantial Completion also remained at June 8,

text: FHA03 – Harold Stage 3 Amtrak:  The ESA PMT opened Stage 3 of the project in July 2013
label: BODY

text: with the authorization for all Amtrak disciplines to participate in the installation of the concrete
label: BODY

text: slabs for the support of Lines 2 and 4 for when the future jacked box for the Westbound Bypass
label: BODY

text: tunnel is installed.  This involved Track Department removal and reconstruction of
label: BODY

text: approximately 1,000 LF of each track along with the appropriate C&S and ET support as the
label: BODY

text: slabs were installed.  The ESA PMT established an initial Estimate at Completion of $1,914,000
label: BODY

text: for the work with a Substantial Completion date of August 20, 2013.  A special summer track
label: BODY

text: outage was scheduled from July 19 to August 18, 2013, for the construction.  As of August 31,
label: BODY

text: 2013, Amtrak completed all of its planned work for this early Stage 3 task on schedule.
label: BODY

text: Construction Progress:  Amtrak Track personnel removed and reconstructed approximately
label: BODY

text: 1,000 LF of Line 2 during July 2013 and approximately 1,000 LF of Line 4 during August 2013.
label: BODY

text: The C&S and ET Departments supported this work as appropriate during the summer track
label: BODY

text: outage.

label: HH1

label: BODY

text: 900 LF of track on Lines 2 and 4 and install 2 turnouts contiguous with the Amtrak work.  The
label: BODY

text: ESA PMT has not established an initial Estimate at Completion for this early LIRR Stage 3 work
label: BODY

text: yet, but it did establish the Substantial Completion date of August 20, 2013.  Monthly and
label: BODY

text: cumulative construction progress was the same through July 31, 2013.  Actual progress was
label: BODY

text: 25.0% versus 25.0% planned.
label: BODY

text: Construction Progress:  LIRR Track personnel removed and reconstructed approximately 900 LF
label: BODY

text: of track and installed 1 new turnout on Line 2 during July 2013.  In August 2013, LIRR Track
label: BODY

text: personnel removed and reconstructed approximately 900 LF of track and installed 1 new turnout
label: BODY

text: on Line 4.
label: BODY

text: d. Quality Assurance and Quality Control (QA/QC)
label: HH1

text: ESA Project Quality Manual (PQM):  The ESA Quality Manager and MTACC’s Chief of
label: HH1

text: Quality, Safety, and Site Security are still finalizing a draft of Revision 7 of the PQM and it is
label: BODY

text: now scheduled to be sent to the PMOC for review by the middle of September 2013.
label: BODY

text: Submission of As-Builts:  The construction Contractor for the CH053, CH054A, and CQ032
label: HH1

text: Contracts continues to submit as-built drawings late and those that are submitted are not being
label: BODY

text: sent as CAD files per contractual requirement, so ESA asked the GEC to convert them to the
label: BODY

text: proper format.  The PMOC is concerned that this issue is still not resolved and that the
label: BODY

text: Contractor is not complying with their contractual requirement.  The PMOC recommends that
label: BODY

text: ESA management press to immediately resolve this issue.
label: BODY

text: PMP-Related Procedures Training:  MTACC has issued 78 procedures.  Training for the ESA
label: HH1

text: staff commenced in July 2013. On August 7, 2013, training was conducted for 45 ESA
label: BODY

text: employees on seven MTACC Construction Procedures and on August 21, 2013, 51 ESA
label: BODY

text: employees were trained on one Configuration Management Procedure.  Training for six more
label: BODY

text: Construction Procedures is scheduled for September 4, 2013.  MTACC plans to conduct training
label: BODY

text: sessions every two weeks and cover additional subjects including Safety and Administration.
label: BODY

text: The PMOC will continue to monitor progress in this area.
label: BODY

text: 2.0 SCHEDULE DATA
label: HH1

text: The PMT did not submit its IPS#50 this month, and stated in its monthly report that “ESA
label: BODY

text: continues its program level review with a target for issuing a revised draft baseline for review in
label: BODY

text: September 2013.  Until such time as that rebaseline is issued, the monthly schedule report will
label: BODY

text: only contain narrative and simple start, finish dates for active contracts.”  ESA has stated in its
label: BODY

text: June 2013 Quarterly Progress Report that a draft baseline will be ready for review in mid-
label: BODY

text: September 2013.
label: BODY

text: August 2013 Monthly Report
label: HH1

text: MTACC-ESA
label: BODY

text: The ESA PMT briefed the FTA/PMOC on the CM005/006 contracts cost and schedule status on
label: BODY

text: August 16, 2013.  The CM005 Contract has a 29 month duration (to substantial completion).
label: BODY

text: The CM006 Contract has a schedule duration projection of 32 months (inclusive of two months
label: BODY

text: embedded contingency).
label: BODY

text: ESA presented a preliminary “top down” schedule for Contract CM007 as part of a briefing to
label: BODY

text: the FTA/PMOC on that Contract on August 28, 2013.  The overall duration of this contract is 39
label: BODY

text: months with a projected NTP of April 7, 2016 (unlimited access) and Substantial Completion on
label: BODY

text: July 5, 2019.  NTP for limited access is projected to occur on July 1, 2015 when/if funding
label: BODY

text: becomes available.  Between July 1, 2015 and April 7, 2016 procurement of pre-cast concrete
label: BODY

text: will commence, as well as other submittals and administrative requirements.  The unlimited NTP
label: BODY

text: start date on April 7, 2016 coincides with the substantial completion of CM005 – Manhattan
label: BODY

text: South Structures and the expiration of a two (2) month hand-off period between contracts.  This
label: BODY

text: Contract will also have two months of embedded contingency.
label: BODY

text: As it currently stands, the original 42 month projected duration of the CM012R Package has
label: BODY

text: become 69-months for the re-packaged scope of work.
label: BODY

text: Project Critical Path: ESA’s 2012 baseline schedule critical path went through Contracts
label: HH1

text: CM012R (42 months), then a portion of Contract CS179 (only 8 months of total Contract
label: BODY

text: duration), then IST (15 months), and finally LIRR IST (3 months),  The PMOC believes that the
label: BODY

text: new critical path will have the same structure, with CM005, CM006, CM007 replacing
label: BODY

text: CM012R,  however the current project critical path cannot be determined until ESA provides an
label: BODY

text: Integrated Project Schedule which it has stated it will not do until the future contracts are
label: BODY

text: incorporated and properly linked in the IPS.
label: BODY

text: Schedule Contingency:  Schedule contingency must be developed as part of the Program re-
label: HH1

text: baselining effort.  At present, there is no schedule contingency for the Program given that
label: BODY

text: CM007 is now projected to finish 3 months before the current RSD.
label: BODY

text: 3.0 COST DATA
label: HH1

text: Funding: MTACC announced at the May 2012 Capital Program Oversight Committee (CPOC)
label: HH1

text: meeting that an additional $720 million will need to be identified in the MTA 2015 – 2019
label: BODY

text: Capital Plan to cover the new project baseline budget.  The funding request for the 2015 – 2019
label: BODY

text: Capital Program will be submitted to the NYS Capital Program Review Board (CPRB) in
label: BODY

text: September 2014.  The MTA stated in April 2013 that it would review any Program budget
label: BODY

text: changes resulting from the new packaging plan for CM012R and compare it to funding
label: BODY

text: availability in the current MTA Capital Plan.  Results of this comparison were to be discussed
label: BODY

text: internally with the MTA Board in July 2013.  As of this report the PMOC has not been informed
label: BODY

text: as to whether or not this discussion occurred.
label: BODY

text: Budget/Cost:  The PMT has reported that as of July 31, 2013, the actual total project progress
label: BODY

text: was 57.0% vs. 58.7% planned progress resulting from the Current Baseline Budget (CBB) and
label: BODY

text: the actual construction progress was 52.9% vs. 55.1% planned based on invoiced amount.
label: BODY

text: As of July 31 2013, the Current Baseline Budget (CBB) as shown in the Standard Cost
label: BODY

text: Categories (SCCs) remains at the baseline value of $8.708 billion.  There were two (2) changes
label: BODY

text: in SCCs this month arising from transfers of scope related to the former CM012R Package.  SCC
label: BODY

text: #10 (Guideway and Track Elements) increased by approximately $3M and SCC #20 (Stations,
label: BODY

text: FOIA Exemption 5 U.S.C. Section 552(b)(4)
label: BODY

text: August 2013 Monthly Report
label: HH1

text: MTACC-ESA
label: BODY

text: ESA conducted a Risk Workshop for CM006 in June 2013 and distributed some input data to the
label: BODY

text: participants for comment.  The PMOC provided its comments on this data in July 2013.
label: BODY

text: MTACC is planning to issue the final report with the results in early September 2013.
label: BODY

text: The systems work and associated packages (CS179, CS284, and CS084) continue to be
label: BODY

text: evaluated for interface issues.  ESA planned to re-run the risk model developed from the April
label: BODY

text: 2013 Systems Risk Workshop in August 2013 using revised data based on a more current
label: BODY

text: definition of the interface milestones associated with the CM012R repackaged contracts CM005;
label: BODY

text: CM006; and CM007. The model has not been re-run as of the end of August 2013.
label: BODY

text: Minimal progress has been made on producing an Integrated Master Schedule which overlays
label: BODY

text: the ESA Harold work schedule on an Amtrak Program of Projects that may compete for limited
label: BODY

text: resources.  Amtrak provided a schedule for the Moynihan project for remaining work in 2013;
label: BODY

text: however ESA has yet to develop the framework for the Integrated Master Schedule.
label: BODY

text: ESA is currently working on schedule and cost estimate reviews for both the CM007 and
label: BODY

text: CM014B contracts.  These reviews will include updated milestone information available from
label: BODY

text: the CM005 bid and the CM006 risk workshops that will revise contract interfaces and milestones
label: BODY

text: in the Program IPS.  The CM014B risk workshop is expected to begin when the schedule and
label: BODY

text: estimate reviews are completed.  The CM007 risk workshop is forecast for some time in the
label: BODY

text: 4Q2013 and is anticipated to be done between issuance of the Request for Expressions of Interest
label: BODY

text: and the Request for Proposals.
label: BODY

text: The 4D model for the CM007 contract presented at the August 28, 2013 meeting did not address
label: BODY

text: interfaces with other contracts.  In order to be a truly useful tool, the PMOC recommends that the
label: BODY

text: model be updated to provide a capability to run “clash detection” among all interfaced contracts.
label: BODY

text: This capability will allow for a more accurate determination of the interface risks associated with
label: BODY

text: this contract and will make the results of a risk assessment more meaningful.
label: BODY

text: The Contract Packaging Plan (CPP) will be updated after the re-baseline is completed.  There is
label: BODY

text: currently no forecast date for issuing the updated CPP.
label: BODY

text: 5.0 ELPEP COMPLIANCE SUMMARY
label: HH1

text: The current status of each of the main ELPEP components is summarized as follows:
label: BODY

text:  Technical Capacity and Capability (TCC):  The PMOC has completed its review of
label: BODY

text: the draft PMP Revision 9.0, and forwarded its comments to the FTA-RII Office in
label: BODY

text: August 2013.  Regarding PMP training, the PMOC has been advised that MTACC has
label: BODY

text: completed its audits to establish where training efforts need to be focused.  The audit
label: BODY

text: report was forecast to be available in August 2013; however MTACC is now forecasting
label: BODY

text: that the report will be available in September 2013.  MTACC started procedures training
label: BODY

text: in July 2013.  The PMOC will continue to monitor progress in this area. PMOC’s review
label: BODY

text: of the MTACC update to the March 2010 Technical Capacity and Capability Plan for
label: BODY

text: ESA and SAS has been completed and comments were forwarded to FTA-RII Office in
label: BODY

text: August, 2013.
label: BODY

text:  Risk Mitigation Capacity Plan (RMCP):  FTA-RII provided its conditional acceptance
label: BODY

text: of the RMCP in its May 24, 2012 letter to MTACC.  The PMOC has verified RMCP final
label: BODY

text: acceptance based on its incorporation into the RMP.
label: BODY

text: August 2013 Monthly Report
label: HH1

text: MTACC-ESA
label: BODY

text:  Risk Management Plan (RMP):  FTA formally notified MTACC of its conditional
label: BODY

text: acceptance of the RMP (Rev. 2) by letter dated March 4, 2013, based on MTACC
label: BODY

text: correcting an error and expanding discussion of certain risk and mitigation topics.
label: BODY

text:  Continuing ELPEP Compliance: The following ELPEP components continue to need
label: BODY

text: improvement:  Management Decision; Design Development; CCC Process and Results;
label: BODY

text: Stakeholder Management; Issues Management; Procurement; Timely Decision Making;
label: BODY

text: Risk-Informed Decision Making.
label: BODY

text: The next ELPEP Quarterly Review Meeting with MTACC, FTA-RII, SAS and ESA projects and
label: BODY

text: the PMOC is scheduled for September 12, 2013.
label: BODY

text: With MTACC’s submission of its East Side Access FTA Quarterly Report (Apr, May, June ’13)
label: BODY

text: and the July 2013 monthly report, the PMOC notes that the ESA project is not in compliance
label: BODY

text: with ELPEP and is not meeting some of the more important requirements of the SMP and CMP
label: BODY

text: sub-plans to the PMP.  The PMOC’s major areas of concern include:
label: BODY

text:  ELPEP: MTACC is not forecasting and trending either cost or schedule contingency
label: BODY

text: accurately because it does not include the significant cost, schedule and contingency
label: BODY

text: impacts of the CM012R bids over budget event and subsequent cancellation of the
label: BODY

text: procurement in 4Q2012.  ESA has not accurately calculated the schedule contingency
label: BODY

text: utilization resulting from the repackaging of CM012R and the major procurement delays.
label: BODY

text: ESA has also not addressed the need for utilizing project cost contingency to cover the
label: BODY

text: budget shortfall.
label: BODY

text:  Schedule Management Plan:  The ESA project is non-compliant with requirements for
label: BODY

text: IPS Updating, Forecasting, and Schedule Contingency Management.  Additionally, ESA
label: BODY

text: is no longer providing any schedule information about future planned contract packages
label: BODY

text: and has ceased providing the monthly IPS updates.
label: BODY

text:  Cost Management Plan:  The ESA project is non-compliant with requirements for Cost
label: BODY

text: Estimating, Contract Level EAC Forecasting, Project Level EAC Forecasting, Project
label: BODY

text: Level EAC Forecast Validation, Monthly Update Process and MTACC Cost Contingency
label: BODY

text: Management and Secondary Mitigation.
label: BODY

text: Revisions to the ELPEP Document:  On March 19, 2013, MTACC provided the FTA and the
label: HH1

text: PMOC with its proposed revisions to the ELPEP.  The FTA and MTACC have agreed to hold
label: BODY

text: working meetings to progress development of a revised ELPEP.  These meetings had been
label: BODY

text: expected to start during 2Q2013 but have been delayed pending agreement on how to proceed
label: BODY

text: without the revised ESA cost and schedule baselines, which are needed to provide a
label: BODY

text: comprehensive revision to the ELPEP document.
label: BODY

text: SAFETY AND SECURITY
label: HH2

text: Project safety statistics for lost time accidents continue to trend above the Bureau of Labor
label: BODY

text: Statistics (BLS) national average at 2.23 vs. 2.20 lost time accidents per 200,000 hours.
label: BODY

text: Although there has been continuing improvement in the overall project safety statistics (2.23 vs.
label: BODY

text: 2.25 during the last reporting period), several contracts have statistics above the average for the
label: BODY

text: project.  For the CM004 Contract, the lost time accidents are trending above the ESA Project
label: BODY

text: average (3.07 vs. 2.23 lost time accidents per 200,000 hours).  On the CQ039 Contract, which is
label: BODY

text: nearing completion, the lost time accident statistics continue to trend well above the ESA Project
label: BODY

text: August 2013 Monthly Report
label: HH1

text: MTACC-ESA
label: BODY

text: average (5.16 vs. 2.23 lost time accidents per 200,000 hours).  ESA did not report any significant
label: BODY

text: security issues for the August 2013 reporting period.
label: BODY

text: ISSUES AND RECOMMENDATIONS
label: HH2

text: Design: The PMOC remains concerned that the GEC and PMT continue to consistently miss all
label: HH1

text: of their target dates for remaining design activities on the project, not just catenary design.  The
label: BODY

text: level of effort for the GEC will increase significantly given the development of the CM007
label: BODY

text: Contract Package and the potential scopes shifts being considered for the remaining Harold
label: BODY

text: Contract Packages.  The PMOC has recommended that the PMT develop a tracking sheet with
label: BODY

text: firm dates for interim milestones as a tool to augment the design management process.
label: BODY

text: Procurement:  The lack of stability in the Contract Packaging Plan remains a concern.  The
label: HH1

text: PMT continues to shift and split scope among different packages, making it difficult to fully
label: BODY

text: understand the impact of these changes to the overall ESA Program at this time.  The ESA PMT
label: BODY

text: is now looking at repackaging the CH057 and CH058 Contracts.  The PMOC recommends that
label: BODY

text: the PMT give priority to producing an updated Contract Packaging Plan and adhere to it without
label: BODY

text: shifting scope for the remainder of the project.
label: BODY

text: The August 1, 2013 planned advertise date for the CM006 (northern structures) package was not
label: BODY

text: met (this is the second time advertise date has slipped, initial forecast for advertising was July 1,
label: BODY

text: 2013) and the advertisement was posted on August 15, 2013, with proposal packages available
label: BODY

text: on August 26, 2013.  Advertise date for the CM007 (caverns) package remains TBD.  These are
label: BODY

text: critical packages and the continuing slippage of the procurement dates for them is of concern.
label: BODY

text: The PMOC also remains seriously concerned about delays to other significant procurements,
label: BODY

text: namely: Systems Package 1 (CS179) (currently in negotiations since 2Q2012); CS184 (Tunnel
label: BODY

text: Systems which has now been split into two packages); VS086 (Signal Equipment) and CM014B
label: BODY

text: (GCT Concourse and Fit-out).  The Systems work is on the project critical path and award dates
label: BODY

text: for the Systems packages remain TBD.
label: BODY

text: Contract CM004: The PMOC has previously reported on the issues with 245 Park Ave.
label: HH1

text: Entrance, particularly issues with the escalator and acceptance and opening of the entrance by
label: BODY

text: MNR. As of the date of this report, the Project Office forecasts that it will commission the
label: BODY

text: escalator in September 2013 as previously reported.  MTACC has revised the date for Beneficial
label: BODY

text: Use to January 15, 2014. The previously reported issues (MNR acceptance and operations of the
label: BODY

text: escalator and acceptance of architectural railing) are nearing resolution.  The PMOC will
label: BODY

text: continue to monitor these issues to confirm the new forecast date is met.
label: BODY

text: Contract CM013: Through July 31, 2013, the stop work order issued by the MTACC Code
label: HH1

text: Compliance Unit (CCU) for the application of Pneumatically Applied Concrete (PAC) was
label: BODY

text: partially lifted, allowing work in the shaft to resume. The PMOC remains concerned that the
label: BODY

text: impact on the substantial completion date cannot be determined, as the entire stop-work-order
label: BODY

text: has not been lifted.
label: BODY

text: Contract CQ032:  The PMOC notes that the gap between the actual progress and planned
label: HH1

text: progress for CQ032 increased from 2.7% to 28.4%.  Even though the PMT has informed the
label: BODY

text: PMOC that the Contract will be re-baselined, which could alleviate this discrepancy, it has not
label: BODY

text: yet been done.  As a result, the PMOC remains concerned that the Contractor will not be able to
label: BODY

text: August 2013 Monthly Report
label: HH1

text: MTACC-ESA
label: BODY

text: recover any of the lost time.  The PMOC recommends that PMT expedite development of the re-
label: BODY

text: baselined schedule and then follow the new schedule explicitly.
label: BODY

text: Contract CQ039:  The CQ039 contractor completed removal of the four remaining support piles
label: HH1

text: inside the Northern Boulevard tunnel in late July 2013.  Other than punch list repairs, the only
label: BODY

text: remaining construction issue is final compensation grout installation, which cannot be done until
label: BODY

text: the ground surrounding the tunnel achieves sufficient thaw.  To date, this has not occurred.
label: BODY

text: Additionally, there are still outstanding contractual issues that must be resolved before the
label: BODY

text: contractor can declare Final Completion.  Because the contractor is thawing the ground naturally,
label: BODY

text: without any outside influences, it is uncertain when the ground will thaw and, consequently,
label: BODY

text: when Final Completion can be declared.
label: BODY

text: Contracts CH053/54A:  The PMOC remains concerned that costs continue to increase in
label: HH1

text: response to continuing delays to the Substantial Completion date.  Although the PMT and the
label: BODY

text: contractor had been working on a revised construction schedule that would result in an SC of
label: BODY

text: December 31, 2013, it became evident that the date was unrealistic and the parties are no longer
label: BODY

text: pursuing completion by then.  Furthermore, the ESA forecast SC date slipped by one month
label: BODY

text: since the PMOC’s July 2013 Monthly Report, and is now June 11, 2014 (based on current
label: BODY

text: monthly progress rates, the PMOC continues to estimate SC for mid-3Q2014).  In order for the
label: BODY

text: ESA PMT to avoid further slippage, the PMOC recommends that ESA place increased priority
label: BODY

text: on the Force Account support that it supplies for the CH053/CH054A contractor (Amtrak and
label: BODY

text: LIRR supply fixed amounts of support for all ESA contracts.  The ESA PMT is responsible to
label: BODY

text: decide how that support is distributed among all its contracts).
label: BODY

text: Railroad Force Account:  During August 2013, both LIRR and Amtrak completed all the track
label: HH1

text: construction that each had scheduled on Line 4 in Harold Interlocking.  The LIRR reconstructed
label: BODY

text: a total of 1,800 LF of track and installed two new turnouts while Amtrak installed a total of
label: BODY

text: 2,000 LF of Track on Lines 2 and 4 during the special summer track outage.  This work was
label: BODY

text: done in close coordination with the CQ031 contractor as it constructed concrete slabs under the
label: BODY

text: tracks for the future Westbound Bypass Tunnel.  The work was accomplished on an aggressive
label: BODY

text: 24/7 construction schedule, it was completed on time, and potentially lays the foundation for
label: BODY

text: similar prolonged track outages in future years.  The PMOC recommends that the PMT, the
label: BODY

text: railroads, and the contractors continue to work closely with one another so that future project
label: BODY

text: tasks can be accomplished in a similar fashion.
label: BODY

text: Project Funding/Budget:  The PMOC remains concerned about the results of the CM012R bid
label: HH1

text: cancellation and its impact on the project budget.  The PMT has not adjusted its CBB (or
label: BODY

text: contingency drawdown) to account for the CM012R bid overrun costs.  The PMOC believes that
label: BODY

text: the cost overrun on the cancelled CM012R solicitation will leave the ESA Project with a budget
label: BODY

text: shortfall, which will impact the project’s ability to mitigate future cost increases, and may also
label: BODY

text: impact the ability to make timely awards of future contract packages.  As of this report the ESA
label: BODY

text: PMT continues its monthly financial reporting as if the bid cancellation had not occurred and
label: BODY

text: there is no impact to the required budget values.  The President of MTACC stated at the July
label: BODY

text: 2013 FTA/MTACC Executive Meeting that the budget forecast will not be completed until later
label: BODY

text: in 2013; MTACC is waiting for the final cost for the CS179 Contract, which MTACC had
label: BODY

text: forecast recommendation to award by September 2013 but will not meet that date; the final
label: BODY

text: construction cost estimate for the CM006 Contract; which was provided in August 2013 at
label: BODY

text: $361M; and the cost estimate for CM007 (still under development) before providing a forecast.
label: BODY

text: August 2013 Monthly Report
label: HH1

text: MTACC-ESA
label: BODY

text: The PMOC continues to recommend that ESA include the results of the CM012R bid overrun
label: BODY

text: and continuing delays in awarding packages in its official monthly financial forecasting and
label: BODY

text: reporting.  The PMT is obligated under the ELPEP agreement to provide accurate budget updates
label: BODY

text: and forecasts.  By not doing so, it remains non-compliant with the following requirements set
label: BODY

text: forth in the CMP:
label: BODY

text:  Cost Estimating Section 5.2
label: BODY

text:  Contract Level EAC Forecasting Section 5.3
label: BODY

text:  Project Level EAC Forecasting Section 5.4
label: BODY

text:  Project Level EAC Forecast Validation Section 5.5
label: BODY

text:  Monthly Update Process Section 5.7
label: BODY

text:  MTACC Cost Contingency Management and Secondary Mitigation Section 6.1
label: BODY

text: Project Schedule:  ESA stated in its June 2013 Quarterly Report that it is currently performing a
label: BODY

text: program level re-plan, with a goal of issuing a revised baseline for review by mid-September
label: BODY

text: 2013 (as stated above).  The PMT is obligated under the ELPEP agreement to provide accurate
label: BODY

text: schedule updates and forecasts.  By not doing so, it remains non-compliant with the following
label: BODY

text: requirements set forth in the SMP:
label: BODY

text:  IPS updating: Section 5.2, requirement for updating IPS on a monthly basis
label: BODY

text:  IPS component schedules and monthly update: Section 5.3
label: BODY

text:  IPS update process: Section 8.2 documentation
label: BODY

text:  Forecasting Requirements: Section 5.4, requires that the PMT identify budget and cash
label: BODY

text: flow issues that may impact the project
label: BODY

text:  Milestones and RSD slippage recovery process: Section 5.5
label: BODY

text:  Schedule Forecasting and Reporting Process; and Schedule Contingency Management:
label: BODY

text: Section 6
label: BODY

text: The PMOC does not believe that the PMT will be able to provide a viable draft baseline schedule
label: BODY

text: in mid-September 2013 given the status of the following items:
label: BODY

text:  CM007 “top down” schedule needs to be fleshed out and finalized.
label: BODY

text:  Schedules for CM005; CM006; and CM007 need to be inserted into the IPS with proper
label: BODY

text: logic ties.
label: BODY

text:  Systems Package 1 will not go to the September Board as forecast and, based upon the
label: BODY

text: current CM007 top down schedule, ESA may have to re-examine the Systems
label: BODY

text: Procurement due to the interfaces with this Contract (as well as the interfaces with
label: BODY

text: CM005 and CM006).
label: BODY

text:  ESA has not provided procurement dates or durations for any other future packages even
label: BODY

text: though these dates need to be integrated into the IPS.
label: BODY

text:  ESA is currently re-thinking its packaging strategy and schedule going forward for future
label: BODY

text: Harold Contracts that will incorporate lessons learned from previous contracts, regional
label: BODY

text: commitments going forward, and available force account resources and outages.  Based
label: BODY

text: August 2013 Monthly Report
label: HH1

text: MTACC-ESA
label: BODY

text: on discussions with the ESA design group, scope shifts among remaining packages are
label: BODY

text: being planned; however, the PMOC has not received any information about the Harold
label: BODY

text: re-planning effort.  Consequently, the PMOC does not know where this effort stands.
label: BODY

text: Risk Management:  The PMOC remains concerned that the complexity, risk, and coordination
label: HH1

text: of the Contract packages associated with the CM012R repackaging will likely prove to be more
label: BODY

text: challenging than previously accounted for in MTACC’s internal cost estimate and schedule
label: BODY

text: allowance.  To the PMOC’s knowledge, ESA has not fully developed detailed interface
label: BODY

text: milestone dates for Contracts CM005, CM006, CM007, CM014B, and CS179.  There are
label: BODY

text: approximately 40 milestones among these contracts for which access restraints and interface
label: BODY

text: milestones present a major cost and schedule risk.
label: BODY

text: The PMOC remains concerned about the timing and results of the Systems Risk Workshop,
label: BODY

text: which was held in April 2013.  The MTA Director of the Office of Capital Program Oversight
label: BODY

text: stated that he believed the results of that Workshop were of limited value, since interface
label: BODY

text: milestones for CM005, CM006 and CM007 were not accurately defined at that point.  One of the
label: BODY

text: goals of the Workshop was to provide data that would be useful to aid in progressing
label: BODY

text: negotiations on the CS179 Systems Package 1 Contract.  He directed that the risk model be run
label: BODY

text: again, with more accurate data.  MTACC initially planned to rerun the model in June 2013, and
label: BODY

text: then August 2013 when the June date was missed, however this did not occur.  Given the
label: BODY

text: continuing delay in re-running the model, the PMOC does not believe the results will be timely
label: BODY

text: enough to be of value in negotiating the CS179 Contract.
label: BODY

text: The PMOC is also concerned that the process of the comprehensive internal schedule re-baseline
label: BODY

text: and cost estimate evaluation is taking an inordinate amount of time.  As mentioned in the
label: BODY

text: Schedule section in this report, the PMOC does not believe that ESA will have a preliminary
label: BODY

text: program revised baseline schedule ready by mid-September, and there is no forecast date for a
label: BODY

text: new Program Budget.  Given the amount of changes that have occurred in the ESA Program
label: BODY

text: since the 2012 baseline cost and schedule were approved, the PMOC believes that the risk profile
label: BODY

text: for the entire Program has changed significantly, and recommends that a program-wide Risk
label: BODY

text: Assessment be performed right after ESA has a new cost and schedule baseline.
label: BODY
